page.title: 18RELIGION (cont)
page.content: {The}refusal of the authorities to consider the people's wishes caused a large secession from the Parish Church. The seceders went to Midlem where they established probably the earliest Secession meeting-house in Scotland. {The congregation}of the dissenting chapel in Midlem survived until 1912, when the number of communicants had so declined they were unable to support a full-time minister. Services were then conducted by visiting ministers of the Secession Church and the Bowden ministers took two services monthly in Midlem School. After 1929 the services dwindled to one a month, led by the Bowden Kirk minister, which practice continued until 1967. There is no place of worship in the village now and Midlem folk share in the life and worship of the parish church of Bowden
